title.value: Supervised latent factor modeling isolates cell-type-specific transcriptomic modules that underlie Alzheimer’s disease progression
title.justification: This is the title provided at the beginning of the research paper, identifying the core topic of study.
title.quote: Supervised latent factor modeling isolates cell-type-specific transcriptomic modules that underlie Alzheimer’s disease progression

extractions.description: This article presents a study on the application of supervised latent factor modeling to identify transcriptomic modules specific to cell types in the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD). The research highlights the roles of these modules in distinguishing between healthy and AD-affected cells, particularly focusing on the contributions of microglia and other glial cells to AD pathophysiology. The study uses a dataset of single-nucleus RNA sequencing to explore the predictive nature of these transcriptomic modules, emphasizing gene set enrichment analysis to discover biologically relevant processes.

type.justification: The study conducts experiments using data from single-nucleus RNA sequencing to derive and analyze findings, fitting models to real-world datasets to extract actionable insights and interpretations about Alzheimer's disease.
type.quote: Here, we implement a supervised latent factor framework from machine learning tailored to improve the interpretability of snRNA-seq transcriptome effects at the granularity of distinct gene expression programs in AD.

name.justification: The research involves using computational methods and machine learning models to analyze biological data, specifically transcriptomic data related to Alzheimer's disease.
name.quote: Supervised latent factor modeling isolates cell-type-specific transcriptomic modules that underlie Alzheimer’s disease progression

name.justification: The paper focuses on understanding Alzheimer's disease, a neurological condition, through the lens of transcriptomic changes in brain cells.
name.quote: AD is characterized by neuronal loss, the classic feature of the disease that underlies brain atrophy.

name.justification: The study deeply investigates gene expression data from single-nucleus RNA sequencing to understand gene expression modules relevant to Alzheimer's disease.
name.quote: ...the analyzed dataset provided ~70,000 cells sampled from 48 age- and sex-matched donors...

name.justification: The study applies machine learning techniques, specifically latent factor models, to analyze and interpret biological data.
name.quote: Here, we implement a supervised latent factor framework from machine learning tailored to improve the interpretability of snRNA-seq transcriptome effects.

name.justification: This model is highlighted in the methodology as the main tool used for distinguishing between transcriptomic profiles of healthy and AD-affected cells.
name.quote: We hypothesized that brain cells sampled from persons with AD could be differentiated from cells from persons without AD based on a subset of underlying gene expression groups—here termed modules. We used partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA), a class of supervised latent-factor model, to distinguish between these two phenotypes.

is_contributed.justification: PLS-DA is not introduced as a new model by the authors; it is a well-established method applied to this study's context.
is_contributed.quote: ...a class of supervised latent-factor model, to distinguish between these two phenotypes.

is_executed.justification: The model was applied to real data to perform classifications within the study.
is_executed.quote: We used partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA),... to distinguish between these two phenotypes.

is_compared.justification: There is no mention of PLS-DA being compared to other models in terms of performance within the text provided.
is_compared.quote: ...a class of supervised latent-factor model, to distinguish between these two phenotypes.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference title is located in the literature on PLS methodologies, likely cited but not explicitly mentioned in the provided text.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We used partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA)...

name.justification: The study makes use of a dataset from the Religious Orders Study or Rush Memory and Aging Project (ROSMAP) for Alzheimer’s disease research.
name.quote: We analyzed an snRNA-seq dataset containing gene expression profiles from 70,634 cells, collected from the prefrontal cortex of 48 subjects (age/sex-balanced with 24 persons with and 24 without AD) from the ROSMAP study on aging and dementia.

referenced_paper_title.value: Single-cell transcriptomic analysis of Alzheimer’s disease
referenced_paper_title.justification: The data was sourced from this particular study which provides single-cell transcriptomic data for Alzheimer's research, according to the text references regarding dataset origins.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ...dataset obtained from the AD Knowledge Portal (www.synapse.org)... Mathys et al. Single-cell transcriptomic analysis of Alzheimer’s disease. Nature 570, 332–337 (2019),

name.justification: The library Scanpy is explicitly mentioned as used for preprocessing single-nucleus transcriptomic data.
name.quote: In the present study, all further transcriptome preprocessing of the filtered single-nucleus data was performed using the scanpy library.

referenced_paper_title.value: SCANPY: large-scale single-cell gene expression data analysis
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes the usage of the SCANPY library, which is essential for analyses performed in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In the present study, all further transcriptome preprocessing of the filtered single-nucleus data was performed using the scanpy library.
